definition[0]: a situation in which you receive as much money or advantages as you give away
example[0]: Diplomatic negotiations often aim at a zero-sum game.
definition[1]: a situation in which a balance is achieved between something such as money received and something given away
example[1]: The utility business is a zero-sum game - if local governments chopped $ 8 million off their power bills, that fiscal load would just be dumped onto the backs of other ratepayers.
